org.safs.selenium.webdriver.lib.model

Interface ISelectable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IOperable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IHierarchicalSelectable, IListSelectable, IMenuSelectable, ITreeSelectable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHierarchicalSelectable, AbstractListSelectable, AbstractMenuSelectable, AbstractSelectable, AbstractTreeSelectable, ListView, ListView.DefaultSelectableList, ListView.SapSelectable_ListBox, ListView.SapSelectable_m_List, ListView.SapSelectable_m_SelectList, Menu, Menu.DefaultSelectable_Menu, Menu.SapSelectable_Menu, Menu.SAS_HC_PushMenu, TabControl.DojoTabbable_TabContainer, TabControl.SapTabbable_TabStrip, Tree, Tree.DefaultSelectable_Tree, Tree.SapSelectable_Tree

    public interface ISelectable
extends IOperable
    History:
      Apr 25, 2014    (Lei Wang) Initial release.
  May 05, 2014    (Lei Wang) Modify methods selectItem and verifyItemSelection to accept one more parameter 'matchIndex'.
  May 05, 2014    (Lei Wang) Modify methods selectItem to accept one more parameter 'key'.
  May 29, 2014    (Lei Wang) Modify methods selectItem to accept more parameter 'offset' and 'mouseButtonNumber'.
                           Add methods activateItem to double click item.

    • Method Detail

      • selectItem

        void selectItem(TextMatchingCriterion criterion,
              boolean verify,
              org.openqa.selenium.Keys key,
              java.awt.Point offset,
              int mouseButtonNumber)
                throws SeleniumPlusException
        Try to select (single-click) the item according to the item's text (fully or partially given), and then verify if the item has been really selected according to the parameter 'verify'. If the parameter key is provided, the selection will happen with that key pressed at the same time. If the parameter offset is provided, then click at offset relative to the top-left corner of view; otherwise at the center. The parameter mouseButtonNumber decides right-click or left-click.
        Note: There are maybe some callback methods associated with the item-container, but setting select text MAY NOT invoke them, in the implementation of this method we should make sure those callbacks are invoked (we can fire some events.)
        Parameters:
        criterion - TextMatchingCriterion, containing text, partialMatch, matchedIndex as search-criterion.
        verify - boolean, if true then verify the selection;
        key - org.openqa.selenium.Keys, it is the key to press during selection.
        for example Keys.SHIFT, or Keys.CONTROL.
        If user doesn't want any key pressed, please provide null
        offset - Point, the position relative to the up-left corner to click at
        If user provides null, then the center of the item will be used
        mouseButtonNumber - int, the mouse-button-number representing right, middle, or left button.
        it can be WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_LEFT or WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_RIGHT
        or WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_MIDDLE.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException

      • selectItem

        void selectItem(int index,
              boolean verify,
              org.openqa.selenium.Keys key,
              java.awt.Point offset,
              int mouseButtonNumber)
                throws SeleniumPlusException
        Try to select (single-click) the item according to the index, and then verify if the item has been really selected according to the parameter 'verify'. If the parameter key is provided, the selection will happen with that key pressed at the same time. If the parameter offset is provided, then click at offset relative to the top-left corner of view; otherwise at the center. The parameter mouseButtonNumber decides right-click or left-click.
        Note: There are maybe some callback methods associated with the item-container, but setting select index MAY NOT invoke them, in the implementation of this method we should make sure those callbacks are invoked (we can fire some events.)
        Parameters:
        index - int, the index of the item to select, it is 0-based index.
        verify - boolean, if true then verify the selection;
        key - org.openqa.selenium.Keys, it is the key to press during selection.
        for example Keys.SHIFT, or Keys.CONTROL.
        If user doesn't want any key pressed, please provide null
        offset - Point, the position relative to the up-left corner to click at
        If user provides null, then the center of the item will be used
        mouseButtonNumber - int, the mouse-button-number representing right, middle, or left button.
        it can be WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_LEFT or WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_RIGHT
        or WDLibrary.MOUSE_BUTTON_MIDDLE.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException

      • activateItem

        void activateItem(TextMatchingCriterion criterion,
                boolean verify,
                org.openqa.selenium.Keys key,
                java.awt.Point offset)
                  throws SeleniumPlusException
        Try to activate (double-click) the item according to the item's text (fully or partially given), and then verify if the item has been really selected according to the parameter 'verify'. If the parameter key is provided, the selection will happen with that key pressed at the same time.
        Parameters:
        criterion - TextMatchingCriterion, containing text, partialMatch, matchedIndex as search-criterion.
        verify - boolean, if true then verify the selection;
        key - org.openqa.selenium.Keys, it is the key to press during selection.
        for example Keys.SHIFT, or Keys.CONTROL.
        If user doesn't want any key pressed, please provide null
        offset - Point, the position relative to the up-left corner to click at
        If user provides null, then the center of the item will be used
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException

      • activateItem

        void activateItem(int index,
                boolean verify,
                org.openqa.selenium.Keys key,
                java.awt.Point offset)
                  throws SeleniumPlusException
        Try to activate (double-click) the item according to the index, and then verify if the item has been really selected according to the parameter 'verify'. If the parameter key is provided, the selection will happen with that key pressed at the same time.
        Parameters:
        index - int, the index of the item to select, it is 0-based index.
        verify - boolean, if true then verify the selection;
        key - org.openqa.selenium.Keys, it is the key to press during selection.
        for example Keys.SHIFT, or Keys.CONTROL.
        If user doesn't want any key pressed, please provide null
        offset - Point, the position relative to the up-left corner to click at
        If user provides null, then the center of the item will be used
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException

      • verifyItemSelection

        void verifyItemSelection(TextMatchingCriterion criterion,
                       boolean expectSelected)
                         throws SeleniumPlusException
        Verify the item (specified by text, partialMatch and matchIndex) is selected or un-selected.
        Parameters:
        criterion - TextMatchingCriterion, containing text, partialMatch, matchedIndex as search-criterion.
        expectSelected - boolean, true if the item is expected 'selected'; false if expected 'unselected'.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException - if the verification fails.

      • verifyItemSelection

        void verifyItemSelection(int index,
                       boolean expectSelected)
                         throws SeleniumPlusException
        Verify the item (specified by index) is selected or un-selected.
        Parameters:
        index - int, the index of the item to select, it is 0-based index.
        expectSelected - boolean, true if the item is expected 'selected'; false if expected 'unselected'.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException - if the verification fails.

      • verifyContains

        void verifyContains(TextMatchingCriterion criterion)
                    throws SeleniumPlusException
        Verify the item (specified by text, partialMatch and matchIndex) is contained.
        Parameters:
        criterion - TextMatchingCriterion, containing text, partialMatch, matchedIndex as search-criterion.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException - if the verification fails.

      • getMatchedElement

        Element getMatchedElement(TextMatchingCriterion criterion)
                          throws SeleniumPlusException
        according to the element's label to get a Element object.
        Parameters:
        criterion - TextMatchingCriterion, containing text, partialMatch, matchedIndex as search-criterion.
        Returns:
        Element, the matched Element object.
        Throws:
        SeleniumPlusException - if Element cannot be found
